name: Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down - Intermediate Precarious Predicaments
description:
Come learn some ways to make your bottoms wiggle and squirm with predicaments!

**Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down - Intermediate Precarious Predicaments**

You've learned some cute ties, but now you want to learn to make someone squirm. The beauty of predicaments is that no matter which way they wiggle, your bottom is going to feel.... something. The struggle is amusing and relief is debatable.

In this class we will discuss what makes a predicament and how to create tension with rope. We will start with a floor tie and then a couple variations of partial suspensions to add to the wiggling. We will cover adding elements like hair rope, toe rope, gags and bamboo. There will be some smaller diameter jute rope that is great for hair rope available for use during class, and if you really like using it you can buy it after class.

This class is labeled at intermediate, which means you are solid with your single column and double column ties. But, this class is beginner friendly in the way that you do not need to know any specific harnesses to participate. We will also go over uplines and how to best utilize them for this type of scene.

Bring your full rope kit (this should include full lengths, half lengths of high quality rope such as jute, nylon or hemp) as well as your preferred rigging equipment (strap, ring and/or carabiners) and cutting shears. If you do not have rigging gear, you can purchase a climbing strap and carabiner at REI before class. We will mostly be using the hard point for stability, so you don‚Äôt need anything too fancy. You should also bring a fabric blind fold and smaller rope if you have it (4mm or twine is ideal!)

Tops: As this is labeled an intermediate class, you should be confident about your single column and double column ties. You should also have solid knowledge of basic frictions. If you need a refresher before class, review some of the videos here: [www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe](http://www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe)

Bottoms: You must feel comfortable being bound in challenging positions but also skilled at communicating your needs.

All bodies are welcome! There will be modifications offered for all body types and flexibility.

**About Your Instructor**

Mistress Trixie LaPointe is a professional rope artist, dominatrix, performer and educator based in NYC. She has been exploring rope since 2018 and has been sharing her knowledge via classes and private lessons since 2021. She has been regularly seen working as a service top or performing at House of Love, House of X, Tempo by Hit Me Up, Femme Fatale, Chemistry and other events around NYC. She is proud proprietor of her own studio space La Maison Priv√©e in Manhattan, where she holds various sessions as well as small classes and events.

**FAQs**

_What should I bring?_

Bring your full rope kit (this should include full lengths, half lengths of rope) as well as your prefered rigging equipment (strap, ring and or carabiners) and cutting shears. You should also bring a fabric blind fold/gag and smaller rope if you have it (4mm or twine is ideal!)

_What should I wear?_

Whatever you feel comfy in! Bodysuits, shorts or snug fitting workout clothes are generally perfect for classes. Please just keep your bottoms on!

_Any pre-requisite skills needed?_

**Tops**: As this is labeled an intermediate class, you should be confident about your single column and double column ties. You should also have solid knowledge of basic frictions. If you need a refresher before class, review some of the videos here: www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe

**Bottoms**: You must feel comfortable being bound in challenging positions but also skilled at communicating your needs.

_Can I attend solo, or do I need to come with a partner?_

This class will be limited to 10 pairs - no solo tickets will be sold so you must come with a partner. Please note - if you are planning to switch, there might not be enough time for you to try every tie twice.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

**STAY IN TOUCH!**

Instagram [@hitmeupnycity](http://www.hitmeupnyc.com/hitmeupnycity)

Join our [public newsletter](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/newsletter)

‚ú®Location: Lower Manhattan. The space has an elevator. Please email [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) if you need any accessibility accommodations.

‚ú®Full vaccination is required. While we recommend getting the booster shots, we are not verifying them at this time.

‚ú®Consent Policy: All of our events are ASK FIRST events. The rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading our consent policy and behaving appropriately. Read our consent policy in full: [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent)

‚ú®Membership: We reserve the right to refuse entry if needed. Hit Me Up also hosts private events which are invite only, and anyone new to Hit Me Up must apply and be approved to attend‚Äîno guests or plus ones. Please visit [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join) to join. You are welcome to inquire as to your status or that of your friends, but please do not act as if you have an entitlement to access our space or members. Building special spaces is hard, and while we are inclusive and welcoming, we reserve the right to curate our membership as needed to maintain our flourishing community. **If you'd like to sponsor a new member please have them apply as soon as possible. If they wait until a few days before the event we cannot guarantee they will be able to be approved in time.**

‚ú®Please stay home if you are feeling ill or if you have had recent close contact with someone who tested Covid positive (within the past 5 days). You could be incubating and still test negative. Any requests for refunds for any reason will be honored up to the day of the party. Remember: safe, sane, and sanitary Just email [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) [mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) and we will give you a full refund, no questions asked.

name: Monthly Roundtable for Polyamory/Non-Monogamy
description:
Join the Downtown Brooklyn Roundtable for Polyamory/Non-monogamy on **October 17,** at the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture (www.bsec.org) - 269 4th Avenue, between Garfield and 1st Street (Brooklyn). This event recurs on the **Third Thursday** of every month.

The topic will be updated few days before the event.

A couple of important reminders:

*   We kindly ask for a **suggested $10 donation** to help us cover room rental
*   We can bring food/drinks to share (yay!), but please keep in mind the event is still centered on the discussion vs. being a potluck

The Poly Roundtable is a discussion-centered community gathering for those who want to learn about and share experiences/perspectives on topics related to non-monogamy and polyamory. This includes newcomers to poly, long-time practitioners, and those just testing the waters. Folks get a chance to make new friends, learn from each other, share their unique stories and exchange insights that can support successful and healthy non-monogamous relationships. We hope you can join us to contribute, learn, or both!

**Approximate Timeline:**

‚Ä¢ Doors Open - 7 PM

‚Ä¢ 7-7:30 - Arrive, get your name tags, say hi, place your drinks/snacks on the table

‚Ä¢ 7:30-9 - Group discussion

‚Ä¢ 9-10 - Mingle and socialize (and help us clean up the space ;))

**PLEASE NOTE:** This meetup is about creating a safe space for sharing ideas and experiences and having productive and compassionate discussions with old and new friends. It is not a cruising or pickup event, so please do not come with those expectations or intentions as they can make folks uncomfortable and feel unsafe. Help us keep this a safe and supportive space!

Our group values ethics, inclusion, growth and compassion as a means to support each of our unique journeys in developing non-traditional relationships. Please be prepared to bring those values, along with an awareness of the fundamental importance of consent and a respect for all others if you attend our events.

We look forward to welcoming everyone interested or curious about non-monogamy and polyamory :) See you at our new space, the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture (269 4th Avenue, between Garfield and 1st Street)!

In Community,

~ Clara, Faun & Marco

name: Dance at Dusk
description:
Foxie Lou & Gavin James Knittle present

"Dance at Dusk" A monthly Fusion Dance happening every third Thursday the Gemini and Scorpio Loft!

This style is a magnificent blend of all types of dance coming together to create a fluid improvisational partner dance. Whether you're a seasoned dancer or a newbie looking to learn how to move your feet, this style is inclusive for all because of its diverse nature. This lovely Thursday night event is perfect for a date night, a night out with friends or a some weekday fun that will get you home by midnight! Solo folks are also welcome as traditionally dance partners will rotate through the night!

We kick off each event with an introductory dance lesson which will focus on some basics of the dance style followed by a consent talk. Afterwards, let loose on the open dance floor as our talented rotating cast of Dj‚Äôs send us through the night! This event is specifically inclusive of all gender, queer and POC backgrounds, so whoever you are, dress to express yourself and dance the night away!

Class teacher this month: Jenny Sowden

Class Description: Halloween Special - Thriller!

Come learn the infamous Michael Jackson Thriller choreography! Jenny has danced with ThrillerNYC for 4 years performing in the Halloween parade and would LOVE to share it with you! All Levels for a good time.

DJ's: Jenny Sowden and Justin Johnson

Venue: Gemini and Scorpio Loft 267 Douglass st Brooklyn, NY, 3rd Floor

Event time: 7pm-12am

Doors open: 7pm

Class at 7:30, Open dance 8:15-Midnight

OUR TICKET PRICING HAS CHANGED

As our dance grows and we are stepping into the new year we are setting some new pricing for our dances moving forward.

Lesson and dance: $30

Only dance: $20 - $25 sliding scale

Late night (after 11 pm) $10

Tickets available at the door via cash or venmo

The space has a full bar and lounge, two large HEPA filters and central air.

For questions and further info, contact Foxie Lou or Gavin on IG (Mxfoxielou) or (Gav.a.good.time)

name: POWER PLAY: Influence & Control
description:
### Workshop: POWER PLAY | Influence & Control

**Hosted by Nix (the Sirenatrix)**

> This transformative edu-series on Power - designed for Dom(mes), subs, and switches - who wish to gain a deeper understanding of influence and surrender. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned veteran, this workshop will enhance your skills and scenes - and perhaps even your perspective.

> This series of workshops will likely change the way you view power exchange, giving you a new appreciation for the intimacy involved in influence. Raising your voice in a domineering way isn‚Äôt the same as influencing your sub with a single whisper‚Äîtrue power tends to be subtle, grounded, intentional, and deeply connected. In **POWER PLAY**, you‚Äôll learn how to get someone‚Äôs entire mind, body, and soul on board with your desires. You‚Äôll learn to play with resistance, use your physicality, and make your presence felt down to the core. Every session will delve into a different facet of power dynamics. Embrace your role, refine your tools, and discover the depths of power exchange in a supportive educational environment.

**Influence & Control**

*   **Beyond Physicality**: Discover ways to make someone melt - without even touching them!
*   **Building Trust**: Learn how to create a safe container for power exchange that allows for vulnerability and growth.
*   **The Dom/me Detector**: I‚Äôll share my technique for ‚Äúscanning‚Äù your sub for the buttons they‚Äôre begging you to push, even if they‚Äôre unaware of them!¬†
*   **Understanding Desires**: You can‚Äôt make someone melt in your hands if you don‚Äôt understand what they desire.¬†

((Come to all four workshops or drop in for just one! ))

‚Äî-------------------------------------------------------------------------

#### Workshop Format:

*   **Discussion and Practical Exercises**: The workshop will include a mix of discussions and hands-on exercises. You'll have the chance to interact with others, practice communication techniques, and receive feedback.¬†
*   **Solo and Group Work**: You can come alone or with a partner. During the exercises, you'll have the opportunity to switch partners, which allows for practicing with familiar partners and new acquaintances. This helps simulate both established dynamics and pickup play scenarios.¬†
*   **Dress Code and Interactions**: Feel free to dress however you want, whether vanilla or ready to play. Expect to interact with others for the exercises, at least in terms of communication and light D/s. More physical play will be saved for the jam afterwards. We do not pair people up, and encourage guests to make friends and engage to their level of comfort ensuring that all are able to learn and grow. Couples can stay paired the whole time or practice with others if you so choose.
*   This workshop is open to all genders, sexual orientations, lifestyles, singles, and couples. All experience levels welcome. 18+.
*   Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event.¬†
*   Doors open at 7:30pm and close at 7:40 pm. Please be on time and text ahead if you are delayed.¬†
*   You are welcome to wear a mask throughout the duration of the event.

#### JAM After the Workshop:

Stick around for our jam session, exclusively open to workshop participants. During the jam, you'll have the opportunity to practice your new skills on dungeon furniture in a safe and supportive environment. Nix & Rrrob will be available to offer feedback or conduct activities that cement workshop learning. This is a unique chance to develop muscle memory through hands-on experience, working and learning together in a playful setting.

#### Workshop 7:30-9:30 pm - Jam 9:45pm-11:45pm

#### _Near Herald Square / Address given in confirmation email additional info / Elevator Access available at this location_

#### Pricing:

‚óè **Workshop**: Early Bird $30, Classic $40

‚óè **Workshop and Jam**: Early $55, Classic $75

SAVE WHEN YOU GO TO ALL FOUR: Workshops $140 or Workshop + Jams $260

> POWER PLAY: Fall Series (Thursdays @ Herald Square)

> Power Dynamics 101 (Oct 3rd)

> Pain & Physicality (Oct 10th)

> Influence & Control (Oct 17th)

> Resistance & Brat Taming (Oct 24th)

name: Date Night:  A Journey of the 5 Senses (YDS Offering)
description:
Date Night! A new series of new offerings from YDS. Starting with A deep dive into, A Journey of the 5 Senses.

**Date Night at Youtopia DreamSpace**¬†

Welcome to Date Night! A curated experience of the senses for two (or more, we are polyamory friendly üòä). We will be inviting you to slow down, tune in, to the 5 Senses of taste, smell, sight, touch and hearing for a guided intimate exploration of the body.

**How it works**

We will be inviting 11 couples into our cozy abode to nest up and go on a journey through the 5 Senses. We will have multiple chapters in our night, each one tailored around a specific sense.¬†We invite you to cherish, and explore each other's beings through this juicy and expansive experience, going beyond any end goal and moving deeply into the juice of right, now.¬†¬†

**Upper Limits and Boundaries of this container**¬†

*   We trust your autonomy, please engage within the comfort of your current dynamic.¬†
*   The play that we are cultivating in this container is more heart forward, sensual play. No hard kinks, blood or toilet play.
*   This is a couples and more-somes experience, you will primarily be engaging with the person(s) you came there with unless there is enthustiasctic consent from all parties who you wish to expand your bubble with. Please be mindful of your neighbors' physical and energetic space.
*   No leering\*. Polite and consensual voyeurism is permitted.

\*Leering: looking or gazing in an unpleasant way.

\*Your attraction level to what is happening next door is not an excuse for leering. If this energetic boundary might be challenging for you to maintain, please do not come.¬†

**Evening Flow**

7 - 7:15pm Arrival (Door closes at 7:20pm )

7:20 pm Date Night Begins!

9:30 pm Reflection and open space

10 pm Close out the Night

We look forward to co-creating a sweet container of connection with you!

name: Liquid Love - NYC
location: 128 Jefferson Avenue (Please Check Your Confirmation Email for Details) , Brooklyn, NY 11216
description:
Liquid Love is a Collective Journey of the Senses.

**Liquid Love** is an unfolding devotion to Self, communal care, and trust. In this space, somatic awareness and listening are the primary tools to navigate this terrain. The concept is simple: we pour warm coconut oil onto your skin which spreads over your body, permitting smooth, flowing contact with your surroundings and with others. _Everyone is invited to respect their own rhythm and limits to touch._

Doors open at 3:15pm for registration and pre opening circle intentional arrival time (It is highly suggested to arrive close to 3:15pm to allow for time to transition from the busy day to day and spend some time with your body before joining into the group flow.) **_The container will close at 3:30pm as the opening circle starts. Once we close the doors you will not be admitted._** Make sure to bring a towel!!

**_The flow of the evening_...**

Arrival Time

Opening Circle + Somatic Consent Workshop

Liquid Love

Closing Circle

This event is donation-based, with a suggested donation of $50-$125. However, we do not want anyone turned away due to financial constraints, please reach out to us if you need assistance.

Sending lots of liquid love and hugs‚Ä¶

**_\*\*Disclaimer:\*\*_** DreamSpace is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of comfort and safety for all our Liquid Love attendees. Liquid Love is an advanced practice that calls for somatic awareness (If you do not know what this means, please attend our Tantric Latihan: Workshop before attending this experience.) This is an event where you are invited to touch and be touched. This experience is designed for those who have experience in containers that explore consensual somatic touch such as cuddle parties, partner dance, contact improv, etc. We have done our best to design and facilitate a safer space, and a completely safe space is impossible to guarantee. **_This is a sensual, non-sexual workshop_**. If you think that this boundary will be difficult to honor, please do not come. If being in a space where the sensual non-sexual boundary could be crossed would be triggering for you, or cause a freeze response, please consider attending carefully.

The ADVENTURE\[s\] DJs are throwing a spooky, scary installment of The Robyn Party to celebrate Halloween! Come to 9 Bob Note in costume if you can to celebrate the Swedish pop goddess Robyn at the original and longest-running Robyn party and the best pop night on the planet!

Happy October, this one's feeling special... THERE JUST MIGHT BE SOME TREATS IN STORE...üòâ üòÆ

The now-legendary party and its DJs/creators Russ Marshalek, Marley Magaziner, and Chris Choyce were featured by none other than Robyn herself in her short film Missing U, where she drops in on the party for a surprise DJ set.

At The Robyn Party you'll hear all of Robyn's hits, b-sides, lost tracks, remixes, aaaannnd just maybe some tunes you won't hear elsewhere, along with your other pop faves like Carly, Charly, Romy, Gaga, and more. It's a euphoric, uplifting, cry-dancing, life-changing night.

Musically, we‚Äôre gonna get a little weird, a little weird, a little dark. We‚Äôve got some of the darkest stuff and most dance floor-haunting Robyn remixes and creepy femme pop - and then, of course, more Robyn.

Every year, Robyn-O-Ween is a chance for us to spread our bat wings, ‚Äúshow me your teeth‚Äù, and play some tracks that might not always fit at This Party Is Killing You! otherwise, so if you have a haunted pop fave you‚Äôve just been dying hear: send your requests to¬†adventuresbk@gmail.com

Our special guest for this night of Halloween-flavored pop goodness is OHAILEIGH, aka Leigh Barton, from St Vitus, from the internet and from the video for Missing U. She's been a friend and a collaborator for a loooong time and we're excited to welcome her to DJ with us. She spends a lot of time in and around Saint Vitus and with Vitus Presents, and has been called "too spooky" - so we can't wait to hear what she has up her sleeves for us.

There will be multiple costume contests, so if you feel like it - dress to impress:

\-Best Robyn Related cosutme-Best Non-Robyn Pop Diva-Best Group-Judges Fave

For¬†prizes you won't want to miss, and just might have some once in a lifetime chances to win exclusive stuff. And, of course, lots of tricks, and even more treats.

Some special tunes, giveaways, and surprises are in store...so hold tight! You'll understand why more than one fake plastic fang-wearing, fake-blood-covered sweat-drenched partygoer has been heard to exclaim "The Robyn Party saved my life!"

¬†Send haunted femme pop song requests and ALL THE ROBYN REQUESTS!! to¬†adventuresbk@gmail.com¬†

name: Hit Me Up! presents: Gender Affirming Intimacy w/ Lady V & Jamie Love
description:

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Gender Affirming Intimacy
-------------------------------

Gender dysphoria is when someone has an emotional or physical feeling that feels misaligned with their gender identity. Gender Affirming Intimacy is a workshop geared towards helping ourselves, partners, or other loved ones experience the opposite of dysphoria, gender euphoria!

We'll explore how positive, gender-affirming physical, emotional, & mental intimacy can make ourselves or others feel more aligned with their beautiful, authentic selves.

### We'll achieve this by covering:

*   Learning terminology around Trans bodies
*   Identification of the multiple forms of intimacy
*   Creating euphoria through affirming language
*   Adapting to different forms of sexual & non-sexual touch
*   Finally, towards the end of this class, we will help you develop your own ‚ÄúGender Affirming Profile‚Äù or navigate helping a trans partner create their own Gender Affirming Profile!

Gender non-conforming people may also benefit from pieces of this to create their own unique Gender-Affirming Profiles. People who are not familiar with trans bodies or terminology are also encouraged to attend.

We are here to educate without stigma! Please note this class is GREAT for partners of trans people & trans people alike! This is the question you get to ask questions & learn without judgment!

About the Presenters:
---------------------

### Lady V

Lady V (she/her) is a spiritually & socioculturally driven sex-positive educator, community organizer & Professional Dominatrix. Prior, she served as the Program Manager for one of the few agencies in the world specializing in navigating sexuality & gender for people navigating intellectual/developmental disabilities.

Lady V has taught for conferences & sex positive venues across the US. She serves as an Advocacy Board Member for Sex Positive World & proudly helps facilitate their education as the Remote Education Coordinator. Lady V has also served the community by facilitating public health events.

She is an out, proud, & fierce-as-fire transwoman with a passion for empowering others. While hailing from Detroit, Michigan, she has settled in Salem, Oregon, where she serves as the majordomo for her leather family, the Atomic Army.

She hopes to inspire others to enjoy sex positivity from an authentic place, as well as embrace their spiritual place within sex positivity & find healing within it. You can view more of her work HERE at her¬†[website](https://theladyv.net/)¬†or Fetlife at @‚ÄåThe\_Lady\_V.

### Jamie Love

[@JamieLove\_PDX](https://fetlife.com/JamieLove_PDX)¬†(She/they) is the executive director of Sex Positive World; she has been hosting speed dating since 2019. She is polyamorous, queer, and kinky, with a love of shibari/rope bondage. She leads discussion groups and classes on relationships of all sizes, orientations, and dynamics. Her background is in communications, video production, and marketing; check out her YouTube channel ([http://www.youtube.com/c/givenconsent](http://www.youtube.com/c/givenconsent)¬†) and or social media @‚ÄåExploringJamie

### About Sex Positive World:

Sex Positive World is an umbrella organization that encourages and supports worldwide sex-positive communities

We are an entirely volunteer-run non-profit committed to changing societal ideas and values around sexuality through education and empowerment. Our umbrella covers all aspects of human sexuality, including gender and orientation (LGBTQIA), relationship styles (monogamy-polyamory), and sexual expressions (kink, tantra, lifestyle).

We focus on consent and boundaries, how to have a sexy safer sex talk, body-positivity, healthy touch, sexual health, reproductive freedom, trans rights, anti-racism (yes, this is a sex-positive issue!), sex-positive parenting, and more. This organization was founded in 2009 as a single chapter in Portland, Oregon, and we have since expanded to more than 5,000 members and 10 chapters in cities across the US and Europe.¬†[Learn more about SPW¬†**HERE**!](https://sexpositiveworld.org/)

Begin your Saturday night with a glass of sparkling champagne, as the Quartet‚Äôs jazz manouche fills the air with an irresistible joie de vivre, setting the perfect tone to carry you blissfully through the weekend.

**Seoyeon**, better known to many as ‚ÄòV.OLIN‚Äô, is one of well-known Jazz Violinist to have emerged in South Korea. Now She is based in New York, she‚Äôs built up a reputation as a rising star in the world of jazz violin/swing jazz scene. While much of her performance career has revolved around classical music, Seoyeon now finds herself exploring the ‚ÄòGypsy Jazz & Modern Jazz ‚Äôworld, where she is routinely playing gigs in the mostly New York area included Carnegie Hall, Zinc Jazz Club, Ornithology Jazz Club, Sheen Music Center, Clement‚Äôs Place and more.

name: A Rock and a Hard Place: Predicaments for AMAB Bottoms
description:
Join Petite Pretzel and KinkNamePending for an evening class on predicament bondage tailored specifically for the AMAB rope bottom. Our seasoned sadist, Pretzel, and power bottom, KNP, teach the art of prolonging and intensifying your bottom's suffering with meticulous precision. This is an open-ended exploration where students are encouraged to adapt the concepts to suit their unique dynamics and preferences. There's no one-size-fits-all approach; it's about embracing the process of learning and relishing the overall experience.

In this class, we delve into predicament bondage: crafting dilemmas that force the rope bottom to choose between different forms of pain, exhaustion, or humiliation. This is not a collaborative tie; it's a constantly evolving game of cat-and-mouse. The rope bottom seeks escape or respite, and the top skillfully removes those options, creating a captivating dance of control and surrender.

As your ‚Äúevil genius‚Äù guide, Pretzel thrives on creating challenges that evolve into prolonged and increasingly difficult struggle. Her class "A Rock and a Hard Place: Predicaments for Penis-Owners" aims to strike a balance. It's not about making it so challenging that one gives up immediately or so easy that boredom sets in; it's about creating a dialogue through rope. The ropes become a medium for communication, a conversation where suggestions and responses inspire each other.

#### Tickets sold as pairs.

### [RSVP](https://app.acuityscheduling.com/schedule.php?owner=27853603&appointmentType=67520093)¬†$140 per pair

_$60 deposit, $80 cash at the start of class_

#### **This class will cover:**

*   Detailed anatomical information, to improve the efficacy of predicaments and ensure safety
*   Psychological discussion of the perspectives of both top and bottom
*   Intimate ties for genitals, specifically penis and testicles

#### **Who can attend this class? Are there prerequisites?**

*   Riggers should know how to proficiently tie the TK and proficient at tying mainlines/suspension lines.
*   Riggers must know how to check for nerve impingement. You must inform your model of the risks of rope suspension.
*   Riggers and models must have tied together prior to this class
*   Rope bottoms should be able to be tied in an upper body harness and be very familiar with the differences between nerve and circulation impingement.
*   Models must be able to recognise and communicate signs of nerve impingement to riggers effectively and timely. Models should be able to process pain and take enjoyment in intense sensations.

#### **What should I bring and what do I wear?**

People usually wear comfortable clothing like yoga or dance attire. We advise against loose fitting clothing and also jeans can sometimes feel a bit restrictive to move around in and difficult to tie on. Bring your own rope.

#### **Who teaches this class?**

Petite Pretzel is a rope switch from New York City. She has been teaching shibari (Japanese rope bondage) since 2019 at Anatomie Studio London, as well as at other UK venues (Oxford Rope Bight, Tangled Festival Derby, Edinburgh Rope Showcase), and abroad in the USA (Temple NYC), Greece (Athens Shibari), Germany (Eurix), and Sweden (Stockholm Pride). She has performed and taught live for Shambala Festival, Pinky Promise, Riposte Queer Rave, Fox & Badge. Her commercial rigging includes music video credits (Charli XCX, Christine + the Queens), art gallery installation (Elizabeth Xi Bauer gallery), fashion photography and full-length film. She lives in Bethnal Green with her cat, who loves ropes just as much as she does. You can find her on Twitter as @PetitePretzel and Instagram as @Petite\_Pretzel.¬†

Pen (KinkNamePending) is a UK-based rope switch from Croydon, South London. He loves the connections that shibari inspires and the wide range of experiences with vulnerability and trust it has brought him. Outside of rope, he is keenly interested in anatomy and physiology and has studied these topics extensively. He brings his perspective and understanding of the human body into rope and kink. He has performed in the UK as a rope-bottom at Tangled Festival, the Lust Supper, Pinky Promise and Fox Badge; and additionally abroad at Temple NYC in the USA, Eurix (European Rope Exchange) in Germany and for Stockholm Pride in Sweden. You can find him on Twitter and Instagram as @KinkNamePending.

name: HMU Academy: Rethinking Decoupling & De-escalation
description:
We will be discussing the barriers regarding changing or ending partnerships, and how to move through them in new and imaginative ways.

The idea of ending or even changing a relationship dynamic with someone, is terrifying, partly because we fear losing someone we have grown intimate with and because of the messaging we've received about romantic partnerships from the dominant culture leading us to view breaking up, or even a relationship taking on a different form, as the relationship failing. This idea keeps people in relationship dynamics that are no longer serving them, barring them from their own authentic needs and desires.

Championing our own autonomy and our partner's(s) is crucial, in welcoming shifts to our relationships if something is not working for us.

This workshop dives into the emotional and tangible impact of major relationship shifts, and how to move them with compassion, grace and self assuredness.

Key Takeaways:

\-Tools on how to initiate and welcome ALL major changes in relationships

\-Deepened understanding of the "relationship escalator" and how it influences why we stay in relationship structures that no longer serve us

\-Templates, ceremonies and rituals on how to have a conscious, proactive and loving decoupling

**About Your Instructors**

Bear (he/him) & Fifi (all pronouns) are New York City-based Intimacy Coaches, Community Consultants, Event Producers, and Educators. Their work challenges social binaries and standards, addresses the personal barriers that limit human connection, and offers alternative ways of relating that center consent & safety, authenticity, and personal agency on an interpersonal and collective scale. [Follow them on IG here](https://www.instagram.com/bearxfifi/).

name: Queer Kiss & Cuddles - A Bi/Pansexual+ Experience!
description:
**Queer Kiss & Cuddles - A Bi/Pansexual+ Experience! 7pm-10pm (May go longer depending on energy)**

**_Address given in confirmation email additional info, Elevator access_**

**Facilitated by** [Dominus Eros](https://www.dominuseros.com/)

**Join us in an intimate embrace of beautiful and communal energy!**

Queer Kiss & Cuddles is an inclusive gathering that radiates warmth, acceptance, and the vibrant spirit of the LGBTQIA+ community. In a beautiful and warm energetic space, attendees converge to celebrate love in all its forms. Here, affection knows no boundaries as individuals of diverse backgrounds come together to share tender kisses, comforting embraces, and genuine connections. It's a sanctuary where everyone is encouraged to express their authentic selves without fear of judgment, fostering a sense of belonging and empowerment within a safe and welcoming environment.

Throughout the event, laughter mingles with whispered conversations and the gentle sound of embraces, creating an atmosphere of joy and camaraderie. Whether exchanging playful pecks on the cheek or sharing heartfelt cuddles, each interaction is a testament to the power of love to transcend differences and unite people in solidarity. As the night unfolds, memories are made, friendships are forged, and the bonds of community grow stronger, leaving a lasting impression of acceptance, love, and the beauty of queer expression.

In addition to the spirit of the event we will have guided meditation and sound bath cuddle puddles. Spiritual connection enhances an already proven healer in hugs/touch via cuddles and opportunities for a fun and flirty kisses arise in a cultivated container of queer joy.

_Note: This a Queer LGTBQIA+ Centered experience with focus on Bi/Pansexual+ interactions, which if you are curious/questioning we welcome you to explore in an intentional safety forward space and celebrated loving atmosphere._

**The Workshop Experience:** This is an in-person workshop/gathering in a beautiful and private studio space in Manhattan (near Herald Square). The workshop will include 3 hours of mingling, getting to know your fellow humans, spiritual portions mixed in with kiss and cuddles experience.

**Desired Benefits:** You will gain new ways to connect and bond with yourself and your fellow humans. You will be able to connect and explore your own relationship to this practice and all the yummy sensations possible. Opt in event meaning you only do what you feel comfortable with.

*   Introductions, mingling and affirmations
*   Safety protocol, negotiations, and aftercare discussed
*   Varied offerings to how your cuddle/touch experience can be explored
*   Fun and flirty kissing styles are discussed with opportunity to be explored
*   Group led meditative sequence using Kundalini Cobra Breath
*   Cuddle Puddle with sound bath
*   Group open free time for kiss & cuddles experience
*   Closing circle and shares

**What to bring?**

*   Comfy clothing, large towel/blanket, plushies/pillow, any other items to enhance your personal experience
*   Open, curious minds

**Workshop Tickets:** Early Bird $30, Regular $40

**NOTE:** We encourage everyone to have an open mind as this is a fun, open and explorative learning environment. We practice and review informed & ongoing consent practices with an emphasis on mutual opt in desire. This workshop is open to all gender identifications, sexual orientations, lifestyles, and we do not pair anyone as we honor genuine connections that arise in the evening.

This event is perfect and open for all experience levels.18+ for workshops. Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event. Doors open at 7pm and closes at 7:15 pm please be on time.

‚ú® When / how do I pay? Upon RSVP, guests will receive a secure payment form sent via the email address and phone number provided. This payment form must be completed within 24 hours of receiving it. Any guests who do not complete their payment form within 24 hours of receiving it will have their RSVP voided with no option for re-entry.

Whether you feel like you're a words smith or a horrendous public speaker - this class is for you! Lola Jean has a gift of gab, but she designed this class for even the timidest of speakers.

Whether words are your only tool or just a little sprinkle to your scene, you don't need to be a tongue twisting wordsmith to master mental domination. Verbal domination pulls from many of the same tactics as physical, only your words are the tools. Learn how to trap someone in their own mind and use their thoughts against them. When we play with mind the only bounds are that of our imagination. We can play in fantasy as much as we play in reality.

We will run the gamut from sweet to sadistic. In this class you will learn how to incorporate more verbal elements pre, during, and post-scene. Learn how to use someones words to inspire and further the scene, how to create a world that isn't there and how to find, expose and RELEASE an insecurity.

In addition to these overall concepts, you will walk away with several tactics and tools build to confuse, gain intel, and direct particular attention to the words you are saying. whatever your heart desires

name: 4 Elements - The Technique of Sensual Rope Bondage  by Tati Limati
description:
Imagine yourself in a shibari laboratory‚Äîa place dedicated to the exploration of techniques, feelings, sensations, silence, dance, energy, animal instincts, meditation, philosophy, aesthetics, intensity, and discipline... all through the medium of rope.¬†

In this space, you study a variety of techniques designed to open you up and bring more meaning to the dynamics of being gentle or tough. You learn to be mindful of breathing and emotional states, especially your own. The goal is to be as sincere and free as possible in the expression of shibari.

The four elements of shibari‚Äî"Air," "Earth," "Fire," and "Water"‚Äîare not merely a classification within a body-oriented approach; they also serve as a philosophical foundation that can unlock even greater potential and value within you, inspiring a deeper connection with others. This foundation, built upon years of experience, is presented in a pragmatic form accessible to everyone.

In this introductory workshop we will touch in some of the main techniques that characterize this approach, such as:

*   Theory of history and philosophy: "4 Elements" with demonstrations of each practice included in Shibari (Aikido, Thai massage, Contact Improv, Qigong, Tantra, BDSM)
*   Body mechanics of movement and points of influence on the body
*   Practice of four behavioral techniques for easier improvisation with ropes
*   "Ichi Nawa": Working with one rope to create a sensual connection with a partner
*   Different options for predicament ties
*   Exploring the senses in sensual tying
*   How to create a story with ropes
*   Developing empathy
*   Sensual "4 Elements" Gote Shibari and the art of touching your partner's heart

**Prerequisites**:

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Single column tie

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Wrapping, tension and reverse tension

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Have an understanding of basic frictions: half hitch, nodome, yuki fix

\- ¬† Gote (Tekate Kote) shibari ( some understanding, can be¬† rudimentary)

Suitable for Beginner-Intermediate and Advanced levels

#### Materials:

You need 4 ropes 7-8 meters long.

Bring comfortable clothing.

If you like to take notes during class, please bring pen and paper.

This workshop is ideally followed as a couple, but it is also possible to self-tie.

Switching is allowed.

**You should know these shibari basics:**

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Single column tie

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Wrapping, tension and reverse tension

\- ¬† ¬† ¬† Have an understanding of basic frictions: half hitch, nodome, yuki fix

\- ¬† Gote (Tekate Kote) shibari

#### **About Tati Limati**

Tati is a Ukrainian shibari artist and instructor.

She studied in Europe and Japan. Among others, her teachers were Naka Akira, Ren Yagami, Kinoko Hajime, Nicolas Yoroi. She also studied the Yukimura style. She has a background in aikido, tango, contact improvisation, femdom, tantra and other practices. She is currently studying to obtain a third higher education degree in psychology.

Tati is the organizer of international events in Ukraine and Poland and a regular contributor to Shibari Theatre in Asia and around the world. Tati is also a traveler. She currently lives in Thailand.

Over the course of 12 years, Tati Limati has not just been training her rope skills, but researched many techniques and practices to integrate in her shibari practice. She combines elements of martial arts, contact improvisation, tantra, qi gong and Thai massage with the purpose of adding depth and sincerity to her own shibari work.

¬†In her teachings, she intends to help participants explore their underlying motivations and add deeper layers to their shibari play. With her techniques she aims to develop an understanding and the use of improvisation, making her students actively establish their own identities in rope play, instead of copying others without questioning.

Since it is spooky season, we will have some Halloween jigsaw puzzles to work on together while we hang, as well as some metal puzzles and banangrams so there‚Äôs something for everyone!¬†

This bar has an outdoor area on the sidewalk for any who prefer to stay outdoors due to Covid reasons.¬†

There is a kitchen at the bar where you can order food. The bar asks that everyone order at least one drink or food item since they are letting us use the space.¬†

Please note: the bar will still be open to the public, so we will just be enjoying puzzling and swapping puzzles respectfully. Unfortunately due to this we cannot control mask wearing or exposure concerns. This is a queer bar and a safe space for our community from what I have experienced.¬†

Final notes: this is a ground level bar with one small step in regard to accessibility. Everyone is welcome to stay and enjoy the bar before/after the event!

I look forward to meeting you and puzzling together! ü§ó üß©

name: The Feels Queer edition 3: an event for LGBTQIA+ love seekers in BK
description:
An conscious dating event for all in search of deeper connection

**// about \\\\**

The Feels mixes time to meet and connect casually, with a 90 min facilitated portion. the format was built in partnership with Columbia University; it blends positive psychology, mindfulness, non violent communication + somatic awareness practices.

We believe that when you feel grounded + good in your body, an openness is available - and that space is ideal for connecting to others. We'll guide you to that place.

Data shows that 70% of all attendees walk out with the contact info for someone they're excited about + that 'the feels' is 2x more effective than a typical singles event.

**// the who \\\\**

this edition of the feels is for those who are ISO queer connection. It's open to all sexual orientations and gender identities within in the LGBTQIA+ community.

**// pls note \\\\**

**We do not offer refunds, as we're a small business and unable to accommodate refund or credit requests for future events.**

However, you‚Äôre welcome to transfer your ticket to the same event in the same category. For example, if you purchased a ticket for Queer 3, you can transfer or sell it to another person for that same event. You are responsible for finding a replacement. Once the switch is confirmed, please email us their name and email.

While we typically don't offer credits for future events, we‚Äôre more flexible with our Queer and ENM events as we continue to grow those communities.

**For further questions on ticket transfers please refer to our** [**FAQ page**](https://catchthefeels.co/faqs/)**.**

**// ticket price accomodation \\\\**

If you have a desire to attend but your financial resources are limited, please email us at support@catchthefeels.co and we‚Äôll do our best to accommodate.¬†

name: Bedroom Badass Kinky Class and Practice: Beginner Rope 2 (part 1 not required to attend)
description:
House of Scorpio

presents

Bedroom Badass class & practice¬†

Topic: Beginner Rope 2 (part 1 not required to attend)

Wed 10.23, 7-11pm, 21+ (25+ suggested), HoS members only\*\*

Main space: class followed by guided practice, $0-30 depending on membership level

Bar & lounge: HoS Clubhouse, $FREE\*\*\*

Gemini & Scorpio Loft, 267 Douglass St, 3rd fl (ADA accessible)

Official info: http://www.houseofscorpio.com/events.html

Memberships & tix: http://www.houseofscorpio.com/membership.html (log in to buy tix)

FB: https://www.facebook.com/events/2290053288009826

FL: https://fetlife.com/events/1610693

PL: https://plra.io/m/bedroom-badass-kinky-class-and-practice-rope-par

Socials: @gemini\_scorpio #houseofscorpio

Although rope seems like the obvious choice of bondage material to many, it is a very difficult medium for beginners to manipulate properly. We will make it easy for you by introducing basic safety and tool concepts before moving onto basic rope restraint techniques. These rope ties can be used decoratively and restrictively in a variety of positions, which can be customized to meet yours and your partners' physical abilities and personal goals.

Some topics to be covered:

\- Why rope?

\- Safety basics

\- Rope tension

\- Scene experience options

Demos & practice:

\- Connected tying demo/exercise

\- Beginner friendly Wrist & Ankle Cuffs with Options

\- Basic Chest Harness with Flexibility Options

\- Simple Full Body Harness

All BB classes are a mixture of lecture, hands-on experience, and dedicated Q&A time. After class, stay for dedicated practice & play time to help you solidify your skills, while our teacher remains available for guidance. Class and practice are in the main space, while the bar lounge is open 7pm-12am if you want to arrive early or leave late -- or just need a break. Always BYO practice items, where relevant, though we will always have a selection on hand.

Our teacher: Multithreaded/Mike (He/Him) Is a long time rope enthusiast with 10+ years of experience in the NYC Rope/Kink community. He enjoys exploring the power and versatility of rope as a creative act of communication, connection, and shared experience through an improvisational and observant style. He also enjoys sharing knowledge and helping others along their rope journey.¬†

Bedroom Badass is our series of workshops to take couples and individuals through various steps in opening up their relationships, or in exploring more adventurous sexual experiences. Whether you're a total novice or an old pro, each class has a range of information relevant to all experience levels.

\*Bedroom Badass happens on the second and fourth Wednesday of each month

\*\*HoS rules: HoS membership required; dress code, PAL or prior approval not required; Code of Conduct always applies; no photos except in the designated front area.

\*\*\*Plus: House of Scorpio Clubhouse.

Whatever your membership level, you are invited to use our space as your own for the night...as your clubhouse. While the ticketed activities will take place on the stage side of the room, the bar and lounge will remain open 7pm-11pm (12am if enough people are lounging). Just like with regular events, if you're Friend level and above, you can bring up to two friends with you. Order in dinner, have a few drinks, run a friendly board game, or just read a book on the comfy couch. This is not a mixer -- just us opening our doors for our members. It's up to you how much you socialize, if at all, and with whom.

COVID safety: HoS requires proof of vaccination on file; masks encouraged; two hospital grade UV air purifiers cycle the air.

description:
Yet another form of fun taught by our favorite duo ‚Äî¬†Bruce & Shermie! ‚ô°

Yet another form of fun taught by Taillor's favorite duo ‚Äî Bruce & Shermie! ‚ô° Learn how to use pallet wrap to suspend someone above the ground, safely and beautifully during this special 3 hour class. Covering pallet wrap mummification, bondage, and suspension.

**About the Hosts**

With many decades of scene experience, [Shermie](https://twitter.com/Shermie_3) & [Bruce](https://twitter.com/ParkingQueens) are the _‚ÄúStatler & Waldorff‚Äù_ of the Kink community. Bruce is a Master Builder and Curator of large BDSM equipment with a unique ability to teach from the bottom. Shermie is a retired Physician and Educator who bottoms and service-tops with both fire and medical play.

**#TaillorCollective #ToEitherPleaseOrEducat**e

**Who are we?**

The Taillor Group is a collective of fierce femme-identifying Dommes headquartered in our beautiful residential dungeon in Bushwick. We are dedicated to the BDSM lifestyle and community, and offer a range of ways to be involved.

**What is this event?**

Our workshops are social, group gatherings that bring members of the BDSM community together in a playful and educational setting. Workshops generally run one hour long are intended to be spaces of learning, and practicing techniques honed in the class. Workshops are not open play-time (unless specifically stated otherwise).

**Where is The Crown located?**

In Prospect Lefferts Gardens, Brooklyn. Walking distance from the train. Exact address on confirmation page, and ticket after purchasing.

**DOOR TIMES:**

Doors for the event will open precisely 5 minutes before starting time and close precisely at 10 minutes after. Please arrive on time for all events.

**TICKETS:**

Participating Sub Ticket: to participate and be used. We welcome participating subs of all genders.

General Admission Ticket: only to watch.

Participating Domme Ticket: For outside dommes, or dominant femme identifying folk who wish to try out what they learn in class.

Single submissive attendees are especially encouraged to attend, as we use workshops to hone our techniques and better our craft as Dommes. We know you need us... desperately. But, we need you!

**Dress Code:**

CDUS (Clothed Dominant, Unclothed Submissive) encouraged. Cross-Dressing and fetishwear appreciated.

**GOOD TO KNOW:**

This event is 21+- The Taillor Collective plays SSC (safe, sane, and consensual).

The Crown is a space for everyone to feel safe and welcomed. We have a zero-tolerance policy towards any kind of hate within our space. Ableism, racism, fatphobia, transphobia, homophobia, misogyny, and/or misogynoir will result in immediate expulsion.

**STILL HAVE QUESTIONS?**

Call or text us at +1 (347) 855 4877, or send an email to events@taillors.com

**NO REFUNDS**

name: POWER PLAY: Resistance & Brat Taming
description:
### Workshop: POWER PLAY | Resistance & Brats

**Hosted by Nix (the Sirenatrix)**

> This transformative edu-series on Power - designed for Dom(mes), subs, and switches - who wish to gain a deeper understanding of influence and surrender. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned veteran, this workshop will enhance your skills and scenes - and perhaps even your perspective.

> This series of workshops will likely change the way you view power exchange, giving you a new appreciation for the intimacy involved in influence. Raising your voice in a domineering way isn‚Äôt the same as influencing your sub with a single whisper‚Äîtrue power tends to be subtle, grounded, intentional, and deeply connected. In **POWER PLAY**, you‚Äôll learn how to get someone‚Äôs entire mind, body, and soul on board with your desires. You‚Äôll learn to play with resistance, use your physicality, and make your presence felt down to the core. Every session will delve into a different facet of power dynamics. Embrace your role, refine your tools, and discover the depths of power exchange in a supportive educational environment.

Resistance & Brat Taming
------------------------

*   **The Dance of Resistance**: Understand the dynamics of resistance and how to use it to heighten the tension and excitement in your scenes.
*   **Taming the Brat**: Learn the art of brat taming, how to enjoy playful resistance, and transform it into a powerful exchange of energy.
*   **Power Struggles**: When you feel a ‚ÄúClash‚Äù between you and your counterpart, learn how to move the energy.

((Come to all four workshops or drop in for just one! ))

‚Äî-------------------------------------------------------------------------

#### Workshop Format:

*   **Discussion and Practical Exercises**: The workshop will include a mix of discussions and hands-on exercises. You'll have the chance to interact with others, practice communication techniques, and receive feedback.¬†
*   **Solo and Group Work**: You can come alone or with a partner. During the exercises, you'll have the opportunity to switch partners, which allows for practicing with familiar partners and new acquaintances. This helps simulate both established dynamics and pickup play scenarios.¬†
*   **Dress Code and Interactions**: Feel free to dress however you want, whether vanilla or ready to play. Expect to interact with others for the exercises, at least in terms of communication and light D/s. More physical play will be saved for the jam afterwards. We do not pair people up, and encourage guests to make friends and engage to their level of comfort ensuring that all are able to learn and grow. Couples can stay paired the whole time or practice with others if you so choose.
*   This workshop is open to all genders, sexual orientations, lifestyles, singles, and couples. All experience levels welcome. 18+.
*   Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event.¬†
*   Doors open at 7:30pm and close at 7:40 pm. Please be on time and text ahead if you are delayed.¬†
*   You are welcome to wear a mask throughout the duration of the event.

#### JAM After the Workshop:

Stick around for our jam session, exclusively open to workshop participants. During the jam, you'll have the opportunity to practice your new skills on dungeon furniture in a safe and supportive environment. Nix & Rrrob will be available to offer feedback or conduct activities that cement workshop learning. This is a unique chance to develop muscle memory through hands-on experience, working and learning together in a playful setting.

#### Workshop 7:30-9:30 pm - Jam 9:45pm-11:45pm

#### _Near Herald Square / Address given in confirmation email additional info / Elevator Access available at this location_

#### Pricing:

name: Welcome to Dykea: A HypeDykes Comedy Show Halloween Edition!
description:
Event description
-----------------

**ABOUT**

Come enjoy a stand-up comedy show celebrating the best in queer comedy! A lineup made of some of our favorite comedians who you'll love so much you'll want to adopt a dog and move upstate with them! Featuring Olivia Von Blue, Kendall Davis, Chiara Montali & Sophia Pelton!¬†

**ARRIVAL**

The show begins at 7:30 so we suggest you come before then to secure your spot and get a refreshment from one of the lovely bartenders.¬†¬†

**COVID PROTOCOLS**

As showrunners one of our biggest missions is to create a safe space for all to enjoy. This is why we take additional measures to make our shows an event even our friends with autoimmune and other conditions can feel okay in! We encourage you to wear a mask, especially while the performers are on stage, but this is a safe space in every sense of the word so we respect what makes you feel comfortable as well.

location: Exact address will be sent to you via email. , Brooklyn, NY 11225
description:
Queer play never felt so good

**About this event:**

A kinky play party for the LGBTQIA2S+ community hosted by the Taillors femdoms and dommxs. This party is centering femme, enby, agender, gnc, genderqueer, genderf\*cker, ace, two-spirit, intersex, and trans queers.

This is a 21+ event.

**What is this event?**

We are a group of domme/xs, many of whom identify as queer, and we want to open up our dungeon space monthly to our LGBTQIA2S+ community to create a safe space to practice kink for us, by us. Come play saucy games, get to know other hotties, or even dare to approach one of our domme/xs for a mini-session!

**Rough Schedule:**

7:00pm: Introduction Circle and Consent Agreement (Safety rules!)

7:15pm: Ice-breaker Game (Some of our favorites include human furniture musical chairs, ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs Spanking Me,‚Äù and Strap-On Swordfight - so bring those paddles and straps!)

7:30-10pm: Free Play/Mingling!

**\*BYOB**. Bring some beverages or snacks to share! There is a fridge to keep your libations cool. Cups provided. FYI: While this is not a sober space, obvious intoxication will not be tolerated in play.

**\*Cis men** - you are not the focus of this party. We love you, we see you, but we are seeking to decenter you within this particular space, on this particular night. If you must be present, you must be a guest of one of our non-cis male guests, you must purchase our ‚ÄúGuest Pass,‚Äù and you must enter and exit with the person of whom you are a guest, and said person is also responsible for you and your behavior during your time within our space. Thank you for understanding and we will see you at our next party!

**\*Non-LGBTQIA2S+ (hetero) allies** - we are aiming to keep this party a queer space and we ask that you please come out to one of our other parties instead. We love you and appreciate your support, but the best way to support this event is to please allow us to cultivate a queer-only space this time. See you at our next party!

**Rules:**

The Crown is a space for everyone to feel safe, welcome, and uplifted.

We have a zero-tolerance policy towards any kind of hate within our space. Ableism, racism, fatphobia, transphobia, homophobia, misogyny, and/or misogynoir will result in immediate expulsion. If you see this occurring or you are being bullied or harassed, please immediately report this to any of our Taillor‚Äôs domme/xs present and we will take care of the matter.

Consent is mandatory for all activities. Please always ASK FIRST prior to touching, photographing, filming, or engaging in any type of play with another person or people, and please maintain ongoing enthusiastic consent during play. If someone is making you uncomfortable, violating your boundaries, or harassing you, please immediately report this to any of our Taillor‚Äôs domme/xs present and we will help you.

Stay safe and have fun!

\* If pricing of this party is a barrier to you, please reach out to us via text at 347-855-4877 for a discount code. Please do not take advantage - we have a limited number of these and would like to reserve them only for those who need them.

**#TaillorCollective #ToEitherPleaseOrEducate**

**Who are we?**

The Taillor Group is a collective of fierce femme-identifying Dommes headquartered in our beautiful residential dungeon in Bushwick. We are dedicated to the BDSM lifestyle and community, and offer a range of ways to be involved.

**Where is The Crown located?**

In Prospect Lefferts Garden, Brooklyn. Walking distance from the train. Exact address on confirmation page, and ticket after purchasing.

**DOOR TIMES:**

Doors for the event will open precisely 5 minutes before starting time.

**TICKETS:**

Queer G eneral Admission: This ticket is for open-play (general admission) for those who identify as queer and are not cis-men.

G uest Ticket: No straight people. Cis men must purchase the guest ticket and must be a guest of a non-cis male Queer General Admission (GA) ticket holder. Cis men must arrive and exit the party with their queer non-cis male friend who is the Queer GA ticket holder. Limit of one guest ticket per Queer GA ticket holder.

**Dress Code:**

As much or as little coverage as you feel called to wear. Gender bending, fetishwear and expressiveness are encouraged. You may change your outfit on site.

**GOOD TO KNOW:**

This event is 21+. The Taillor Collective plays SSC (safe, sane, and consensual).

The Crown is a space for everyone to feel safe and welcomed. We have a zero-tolerance policy towards any kind of hate within our space. Ableism, racism, fatphobia, transphobia, homophobia, misogyny, and/or misogynoir will result in immediate expulsion.

**STILL HAVE QUESTIONS?**

Call or text us at +1 (347) 855 4877, or send an email to events@taillors.com

**NO REFUNDS**

### **‚óÜSAFER SPACES POLICY‚óÜ**

House of Yes is a space for everyone to feel welcome. We have a zero tolerance policy for harassment, unwanted touch, and discrimination. Always ASK before touching anyone. If someone is making you uncomfortable, speak to a security guard or ask for a manager - we will help you, no judgment. All restrooms in our venue are gender neutral. The entrance to the venue is ADA accessible. Strobe lights are used during performances and parties. Find out more at¬†[houseofyes.org/safer](https://www.houseofyes.org/safer)

### **‚óÜINFO & FAQ‚óÜ**

**As we enter spooky season and the veil thins, Queen Persephone and her King Consort Hades invite you into their underworld realm‚Ä¶**

You may have heard the story of Persephone and Hades as told through the patriarchal lens of ancient Greece, however when we dig deeper into the oldest myths we find a kinky story of consensual dominance and submission, a tale of deep devotional love between a Queen and her King.

Join us on this journey into the underworld! In this unique ceremonial experience you will be invited to challenge yourself to confront your shadows and meet them in erotic dance as we transmute them.

We will be combining meditation, shadow work integration techniques, Tantra and Existential Kink to work with our shadows to heal blocks that keep us from experiencing our divine birthright of ecstatic pleasure.

Decolonize ancient myths and your own soul while experiencing sensuous ceremonial elixirs, temple sacrament, dance, sound and performances that will inspire and empower you to meet yourself with a love so devotional to the truth of who you are; you will never be the same again.

name: Cuddle Party
description:
**Cuddle Party** **1 - 4:30pm**

_Official Cuddle Party being hosted by Amanda Ananda for Pagans Paradise. Join our growing community of Cuddle Monsters!_

**Facilitated by** [Amanda Ananda](https://www.TheTantricMama.com) in collaboration with [Pagans Paradise](https://www.pagansparadise.com)

Ever just need a HUG? Want to meet new people?

Bring your Pj's and experience a sweet bubble of nourishing connection!!

At Cuddle Party we like to say that we are providing an EMPOWERING communication workshop, cleverly disguised as a pajama party!

Amanda is a Certified Cuddle Party Facilitator and is honored to host these events for our growing community of Cuddle Monsters! Come out and try this unique oxytocin bliss-filled experience and let your stresses melt away.

In our cozy, safe space, we will start with icebreakers and the rules of cuddling for the evening. You will gain practice in setting boundaries, expressing your NO and delivering it with compassion. Simultaneously, you will be encouraged to navigate our space with fearlessness and fun to ultimately discover your HEAVENS YES!

These are skills that can be taken back into your personal life and can drastically improve ALL of your relationships!

You will walk away with newfound confidence and unforgettable memories!

**The Experience:** This is an in-person workshop in a beautiful and private studio space in Manhattan. The workshop will include 3 hours of discussion & instruction where you will be able to receive and explore new techniques and positions.

**Intended Outcomes:** Think hugs, back rubs, foot rubs, nuzzling, head scratching, spooning and all forms of non-sexual snuggling!

*   Connection
*   Friendship
*   Community
*   Personal Development
*   Giving and Receiving Affection
*   Healing Touch
*   Laughter

**What to bring?**

*   Comfy Pajamas
*   Healthy Snacks to Share
*   Water Bottles
*   Blanket, Pillow or Plushies!

**Cost:**

*   Early Bird $30
*   Regular $40
*   At door $60

Doors open at 1pm, Welcome circle at 1:15 and the doors will be closed at that time, please be sure to come within that time frame.

NOTE: We encourage everyone to have an open mind as this is a fun, open and explorative learning environment. We practice and review informed & ongoing consent practices with an emphasis on mutual desire. This workshop is open to all gender identifications, sexuaI orientations and lifestyles. This is an alcohol and drug-free space and nonsexual environment.

This event is perfect and open for all experience levels. 18+ for workshops. Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event.

**About Your Facilitator:**

Amanda Ananda is an International Tantric Facilitator and Domestic Goddess of 2 outrageous young boys. Amanda has a diverse Tantrica background that allows for a unique, blissful and radiant experience to unfold in her workshops, online courses and sessions. Her techniques will help you to become embodied with simple-yet-profound, heartfelt tools that you can apply in your daily life.

You can listen to Amanda talk about Cuddle Party in an interview with Chion Wolf on CT Public Radio here:

[https://www.ctpublic.org/show/audacious-with-chion-wolf/2022-06-02/we-have-to-talk-about-cuddle-parties](https://www.ctpublic.org/show/audacious-with-chion-wolf/2022-06-02/we-have-to-talk-about-cuddle-parties)

You can find out more about the event/organization here: [http://www.cuddleparty.com/](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cuddleparty.com%2F%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR3h4Lxl0FC8HAMnw3bWKpOyXxJLxQvIi4Ea_4rKfEDgAkKXomHb6VOh7QU&h=AT05Uz50oDPDNZqK_HLlQjfkDm9qOj4AiN9Zdc2LbwxFO0kYQ9lNicmE_gBm2MCbH6eUSROczWyAay7y3ycmQKwr2nF4j9qFZWmXVSror_6BZ5TVhRozAVqsel5-8Nt1kHQCfA2giibREEd8erpFJkg&__tn__=q&c%5B0%5D=AT1RfgR-3HzXCqNUPAYz27vC0m8YaMWQAYaLbJP74YvA2Yoq2qvW_2xEHsm37GSuRljj0xhy7eHlEo-8JfcOkY8sTlM5YlfnnQkW_Oum4waPviTF7xIOhyqEoP1KGqYON4g) Check out "What is a Cuddle Party?"

name: HMU Academy: Strength & ConditiK!NK
description:
Join fitness coaches Alex & Lucca for an open-level strength & conditioning class with a k!nky twist. Ticket bundles available!

_This is a public event. HMU‚Äôs public events are 18+. Our vetted & private lists are 21+ only._

Do your arms get tired from flogging someone over and over?

Have trouble hoisting your favorite rope bunny?

Do your legs burn from squatting too much?

Just can‚Äôt wield that paddle all night long like you used to?

**Join coaches Alex & Lucca for an open-level strength & conditioning class with a kinky twist. Ticket bundles available for Sept 30 + Oct 28 + Nov 25 (last Monday of the month)!**

Doors Open: 6:30pm

Class Time: 7:00-8:00pm

Mingle: 8:00-8:45pm

This class is for everybody and every body! Modifications will be offered for each movement depending on your level of experience (with both fitness & with kink). Movements for this class will be kink-functional with a focus on enhancing endurance for impact related play. Please note, while there will be impact related movements, there will be no play during this class. We can't wait to see you there!

**Equipment to Bring:** This class will incorporate movements using kink implements including but not limited to floggers, paddles, whips, canes, etc. Bringing your own is highly encouraged, however there will be a limited number of items to borrow for class. Yoga mat for floor work, and a towel for sweat is suggested but not required. Water bottles are encouraged so you can have your water close by, water will be provided.

**About the instructors:**

**Alex (they/them):** Alex is a lifelong kinkster and joined the Hit Me Up community in 2022. As a nontraditional athlete living in a fat, QTPOC body, they strongly believe in the power of embodied movement and kink! Alex trains and coaches from a HAES (Health At Every Size) framework, and is committed to creating accessible, affirming spaces for their clients to reach their strength, movement and training goals. Alex is a Certified NASM and TI-PT (Trauma Informed) Personal Trainer.

**Lucca (they/them)**: Lucca has been a member of the Hit Me Up community since 2022 (you may know them as EJ). They have coached and competed in a wide variety of sports over the last 15 years including Long Distance Running, CrossFit, Olympic Weightlifting, and Roller Derby. Lucca has experience coaching all levels, and through this class they hope to bring their passions for kink and fitness together to help others achieve their goals in the streets as well as the sheets ;)

**Dress code:** Please wear clothing that you can comfortably move and sweat in. Feel free to dress in a way that makes you feel sexy (and strong)! Booty shorts, bodysuits, lingerie, and kink-wear more than welcome. Be sure whatever you're wearing doesn't restrict your movement. Topplessness is okay but there is **no full nudity!** Lower-half bits must remain covered. Close-toed shoes are required, sneakers or training shoes are strongly encouraged.

**Time:** Class will be an hour long and will begin at 7pm. We will have some time after class to cool down and mingle. Check out our upcoming [event schedule here](https://www.eventbrite.com/o/hit-me-up-69189357793) for more dates.

**Level:** This class is an open level class, we will be offering more accessible modifications and add-on options for difficulty with some exercises. Please listen to your body. Take rest and water breaks as needed! This is a judgment-free zone.

**Injuries:** Recent injuries should be cleared by your doctor/PT before attending class. Please let Coaches Alex & Lucca know about any recent or major injuries before class begins so we can go over any accommodations needed. If you have any questions about your injury feel free to reach out to us: [fatkidathleticsnyc@gmail.com](mailto:fatkidathleticsnyc@gmail.com) & [luccafinley@gmail.com](mailto:luccafinley@gmail.com)

**Pregnancy:** All pregnant and post natal clients should be cleared by their doctor, and must speak to Coaches before class to discuss any accommodations needed.

**Consent:** The rules of consent apply to this class. Please read Hit Me Up's full consent policy [here.](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent) We reserve the right to ask individuals to leave class if deemed necessary for violating this policy.

**Public Event:** This event is open to members of the public who dress and behave appropriately. If you have previously been a member and been specifically notified that your membership was discontinued, please do not attend. If you're unsure, you're welcome to check your status by emailing hello@hitmupnyc.com. (If you are interested in joining our private events, you can always submit an [application](https://hitmeupnyc.com/join)).

**Waiver:** All class participants must sign a general waiver when they arrive. Please review it here.

**Refunds:** No refunds on ticket bundles. Refunds for any reason available for single date purchases.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

**STAY IN TOUCH!**

Instagram [@hitmeupnycity](http://www.hitmeupnyc.com/hitmeupnycity)

Join our [public newsletter](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/newsletter)

‚ú®Volunteers: Limited volunteer spots available. Please email [admin@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:admin@hitmeupnyc.com) to express interest.

‚ú®Location: Lower Manhattan. The space has an elevator. Please email [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) if you need any accessibility accommodations.

‚ú®Full vaccination is required. While we recommend getting the booster shots, we are not verifying them at this time.

‚ú®Consent Policy: All of our events are ASK FIRST events. The rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading our consent policy and behaving appropriately. Read our consent policy in full: [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent)

‚ú®Membership: We reserve the right to refuse entry if needed. Hit Me Up also hosts private events which are invite only, and anyone new to Hit Me Up must apply and be approved to attend‚Äîno guests or plus ones. Please visit [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join) to join. You are welcome to inquire as to your status or that of your friends, but please do not act as if you have an entitlement to access our space or members. Building special spaces is hard, and while we are inclusive and welcoming, we reserve the right to curate our membership as needed to maintain our flourishing community. **If you'd like to sponsor a new member please have them apply as soon as possible. If they wait until a few days before the event we cannot guarantee they will be able to be approved in time.**

Through guided visualization, you will enter a meditative trance state supported by the healing properties of binaural beats and essential oils. description:
**Tantric Trance Dance 7:30pm-9:30pm**

**_Address given in confirmation email additional info_**

**Facilitated by** [Goddess Shakti](https://www.libglobal.org/)

**Join us for an amazing evening of sacred spiritual energy!**

Embracing the Yoga of Sound and the essence of Hatha without doing typical asana poses that we have grown to believe in as an essential element of yoga.

Hatha (Ha-Tha, described as a ‚Äúsun-Moon‚Äù)‚Ä¶. Nothing about poses.

Hatha is described as ‚Äúsun-moon‚Äù to emphasize negative-positive, male-female, these two opposite forces in nature that we meditate upon to harness constructive forceful means to bring about change to our mental and emotional state.

This nourishing and playful practice encourages delicious trance, sensual body movement, and vocal Shakti invocation.

In this practice, we constructively and playfully rebel against convention. We approach yoga in an unconventional way with trance dance and using the power of our voice.

Relish the experience of playfully cutting straight through the noise and chaos of various unpredictable mental states and life and take a break from the stubborn sticky impulses of ego in a trance-supported ecstatic dance practice.

Through this technique we experience the blissful absorption of yoga‚Äôs final stages: dhyana, yoga's 7th limb, and then finally, potentially the final 8th stage-Samadhi.

This is a specific progression of movement modes that promote delightfully deep meditation.

There are no complex or challenging poses or dance moves to work out. You do not need to think, figure things out, or worry how you look.

You are in a totally supportive space that has been infused with unconditional love. We will engage in a tonal voice technique that will help us to tune the divine instruments that we are and harmonize ourselves with the unified field of consciousness as we slide into a deep and peaceful meditative and free state.

**The Workshop Experience:** This is an in-person workshop/gathering in a beautiful and private studio space in Manhattan (near Herald Square). The workshop will include 2.5 hours of mingling, getting to know your fellow humans, spiritual connections and movement.

**Desired Benefits:** You will gain new ways to connect and bond with yourself and your fellow humans. You will be able to connect and explore your own relationship to this practice and all the yummy sensations possible. Opt in event meaning you only do what you feel comfortable with.

*   Release the emotional baggage that accumulates in the body due to exposure to traumas in our life and causes us to suffer.
*   Experience a practice of yoga that is incredibly liberating
*   Re-set the nervous system and get a good physical work out for our bodies
*   Induce in ourselves a state of excellent and bliss-filled meditation.
*   Experience oneness (the goal of yoga)
*   FEEL FREE & HAVE FUN

**What to bring?**

*   Wear fun or fancy dressy dancy clothes (or be liberated to opt for your natural state) for your enjoyment. If you opt to wear clothes, be sure that they allow free movement and sitting comfortably in meditation.
*   Bring water or at least a water bottle
*   Bring meditation cushion and/or yoga mat. (mats are available if you don't have)

**Workshop Tickets:** Early Bird $30, Regular $40

**NOTE:** We encourage everyone to have an open mind as this is a fun, open and explorative learning environment. We practice and review informed & ongoing consent practices with an emphasis on mutual opt in desire. This workshop is open to all gender identifications, sexual orientations, lifestyles, and we do not pair anyone as we honor genuine connections that arise in the evening.
